#summary A wiki page listing all qmmp packages



== Arch Linux ==

A package for Qmmp 0.3.1 can be found in the `[community]` repository.
For SVN builds you can either choose to use the [http://aur.archlinux.org/packages.php?ID=21736 PKGBUILD] from the AUR, or add the following repositories for precompiled packages to your pacman.conf:

If you use the x86_64 Architecture add the following:
{{{
[dstr-repo]
Server = http://dimon.homeftp.org/repo/x86_64/
}}}
If you use the i686 Architecture add the following:
{{{
[dstr-repo]
Server = http://dimon.homeftp.org/repo/i686
}}}

== Mandriva ==
If you run Mandriva 2009.1 you can download the packages from [http://qmmp.ylsoftware.com/files/mandriva/2009.1/0.3.1 here] to install the stable Qmmp 0.3.1

== Ubuntu ==

You can add the following PPA to your /etc/apt/sources.list for SVN builds.

If you run Ubuntu Jaunty Jackalope:
{{{
deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/stiff.ru/ppa/ubuntu jaunty main 
deb-src http://ppa.launchpad.net/stiff.ru/ppa/ubuntu jaunty main 
}}}
and if you run Ubuntu Hardy Heron:
{{{
deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/stiff.ru/ppa/ubuntu hardy main 
deb-src http://ppa.launchpad.net/stiff.ru/ppa/ubuntu hardy main 
}}}

After adding the lines above to your sources.list, open up a terminal and enter
{{{
sudo apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys 2C2B0858
}}}
Now finally run
{{{
sudo apt-get update
}}}
to re-load the details of each software archive. Now you can install Qmmp through the package 'qmmp':
{{{
sudo apt-get install qmmp
}}}
